data.title: Umicore names new managing director
data.meta_description: Umicore Precious Metals Canada has appointed company veteran Paul Koolhaas to the position of managing director.
data.text:
Top Trending

Emerging Toronto designers shine in Botswana

The designs of three recent graduates of Toronto’s George Brown College (GBC) earned international praise at De Beers’ 2019 Shining Lights Awards (SLA) in Botswana.

A change in style: Jewels for everyone—even men

There was once a time when jewellery was almost entirely for women and offered sparse choice for men. We have certainly moved on from those days.

Digital threats: Protect your jewellery business from cybercrime

It is beneficial for you, as a small business owner, to be aware of the threats associated with cybercrime and how you can protect yourself in an ever-evolving digital age.

The sustainability trap

Currently, mining for product used to make jewellery continues just as it always has, with large-scale mines supplying 80 per cent of gold and diamonds and extracting resources as fast as possible.

Polishing pretty stories: Engage customers with the entire tale of coloured stones

Coloured gems sell—we don’t even need to classify them as ‘precious’ and ‘semi-precious’ anymore. Depending on a stone’s provenance and rarity of colour and size, today’s shoppers are willing to dig deep into their pockets and shell out serious money for many rainbow-hued gemstones.
